docs.lead_paragraph: A leading Vatican cardinal said on Thursday the Roman Catholic Church will never bless gay marriage, wading into a controversy over the issue in Italy and other countries.

headline.main: Cardinal Says Catholic Church Will Never Bless Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: Cardinal Says Catholic Church Will Never Bless Gay Marriage

docs.snippet: A leading Vatican cardinal said on Thursday the Roman Catholic Church will never bless gay marriage, wading into a controversy over the issue in Italy and other countries.

docs.lead_paragraph: The last of the Deep South's statewide elected Democrats are hoping their seniority and famous family names will save them from the region's rightward trend in this year's Senate races. But Republicans say only one name matters in these rapidly realigning states: Barack Obama.

headline.main: GOP Banks on Anti-Obama Mood to Oust Southern Dems
headline.print_headline: GOP Banks on Anti-Obama Mood to Oust Southern Dems

docs.lead_paragraph: The Medicare "Part B" premium that most older people pay for outpatient care will stay the same in 2015 — $104.90 a month.

headline.main: Medicare's Basic Monthly Premium Unchanged in 2015
headline.print_headline: Medicare's Basic Monthly Premium Unchanged in 2015

docs.snippet: The Medicare "Part B" premium that most older people pay for outpatient care will stay the same in 2015 — $104.90 a month.

docs.lead_paragraph: Officials said that the revamped HealthCare.gov would not crash, and that most signing up for the first time would visit much fewer screens.

headline.main: Easier Time in Health Marketplace Is Promised
headline.print_headline: Easier Time in Health Marketplace Is Promised

docs.abstract: Obama administration officials say that consumers will find it easier to buy health insurance in federal marketplace in fall, and that HealthCare.gov will not crash; officials, however, provide few operational details to back up their confidential statements.
docs.snippet: Officials said that the revamped HealthCare.gov would not crash, and that most signing up for the first time would visit much fewer screens.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: With an microchip-embedded ID card, residents gain access to thousands of public and private services, including banking, medical records and even fishing licenses.

headline.main: Estonians Embrace Life in a Digital World
headline.print_headline: Estonians Embrace Life in a Digital World

docs.abstract: Estonia has welcomed technology as fact of life; Estonians use national identity card embedded with microchip to gain access to some 4,000 services including banking and medical records; other nations have noticed, and former Estonian Prime Min Andrus Ansip has been tapped to become European Commission vice president in charge of Europe's digital future.
docs.snippet: With an microchip-embedded ID card, residents gain access to thousands of public and private services, including banking, medical records and even fishing licenses.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama is targeting his midterm election economic message to young people born after 1980, a cohort that has shown itself to be reluctant to vote in nonpresidential contests.

headline.main: Obama to Target Millennials With Economic Pitch
headline.print_headline: Obama to Target Millennials With Economic Pitch

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama is targeting his midterm election economic message to young people born after 1980, a cohort that has shown itself to be reluctant to vote in nonpresidential contests.
